edu.rit.gpu.example

Class Prng

  • java.lang.Object
    • edu.rit.gpu.Struct
      • edu.rit.gpu.example.Prng

  • public class Prng
extends Struct
    Class Prng provides a pseudorandom number generator (PRNG). It is the Java version of the CUDA prng_t structure in file Prng.cu. Class Prng can be used to mirror PRNG objects between the CPU and the GPU.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Prng()
      Construct a new PRNG.

    • Constructor Detail

      • Prng

        public Prng()
        Construct a new PRNG.

    • Method Detail

      • setSeed

        public void setSeed(long seed)
        Set this PRNG's seed.
        Parameters:
        seed - Seed.

      • skip

        public void skip(long n)
        Skip this PRNG the given number of positions ahead in this PRNG's sequence.
        Parameters:
        n - Number of positions to skip.

      • nextBoolean

        public boolean nextBoolean()
        Return the Boolean value from the next pseudorandom value in this PRNG's sequence. With a probability of 0.5 true is returned, with a probability of 0.5 false is returned.
        Returns:
        Boolean value.

      • nextByte

        public byte nextByte()
        Return the byte value from the next pseudorandom value in this PRNG's sequence. Each value in the range -128 through 127 is returned with a probability of 1/28.
        Returns:
        Byte value.

      • nextUnsignedByte

        public int nextUnsignedByte()
        Return the unsigned byte value from the next pseudorandom value in this PRNG's sequence. Each value in the range 0 through 255 is returned with a probability of 1/28.
        Returns:
        Unsigned byte value.

      • nextShort

        public short nextShort()
        Return the short value from the next pseudorandom value in this PRNG's sequence. Each value in the range -32768 through 32767 is returned with a probability of 1/216.
        Returns:
        Short value.

      • nextUnsignedShort

        public int nextUnsignedShort()
        Return the unsigned short value from the next pseudorandom value in this PRNG's sequence. Each value in the range 0 through 65535 is returned with a probability of 1/216.
        Returns:
        Unsigned short value.

      • nextInteger

        public int nextInteger()
        Return the integer value from the next pseudorandom value in this PRNG's sequence. Each value in the range -2147483648 through 2147483647 is returned with a probability of 1/232.
        Returns:
        Integer value.

      • nextUnsignedInteger

        public int nextUnsignedInteger()
        Return the unsigned integer value from the next pseudorandom value in this PRNG's sequence. Each value in the range 0 through 4294967296 is returned with a probability of 1/232.
        Returns:
        Unsigned integer value.

      • nextLong

        public long nextLong()
        Return the long value from the next pseudorandom value in this PRNG's sequence. Each value in the range -9223372036854775808 through 9223372036854775807 is returned with a probability of 1/264.
        Returns:
        Long value.

      • nextUnsignedLong

        public long nextUnsignedLong()
        Return the unsigned long value from the next pseudorandom value in this PRNG's sequence. Each value in the range 0 through 18446744073709551615 is returned with a probability of 1/264.
        Returns:
        Unsigned long value.

      • nextDouble

        public double nextDouble()
        Return the double precision floating point value from the next pseudorandom value in this PRNG's sequence. The returned numbers have a uniform distribution in the range 0.0 (inclusive) to 1.0 (exclusive).
        Returns:
        Double value.

      • nextFloat

        public float nextFloat()
        Return the single precision floating point value from the next pseudorandom value in this PRNG's sequence. The returned numbers have a uniform distribution in the range 0.0 (inclusive) to 1.0 (exclusive).
        Returns:
        Float value.

      • nextInt

        public int nextInt(int n)
        Return the integer value in the given range from the next pseudorandom value in this PRNG's sequence. Each value in the range 0 through n−1 is returned with a probability of 1/n.
        Parameters:
        n - Range of values to return.
        Returns:
        Integer value in the range 0 through n−1 inclusive.

      • sizeof

        public static long sizeof()
        Returns the size in bytes of the C struct. The size must include any internal padding bytes needed to align the fields of the C struct. The size must include any padding bytes at the end needed to align a series of C structs in an array.
        Returns:
        Size of C struct (bytes).

      • toStruct

        public void toStruct(ByteBuffer buf)
        Write this Java object to the given byte buffer in the form of a C struct. The byte buffer's byte order is little endian. The byte buffer is positioned at the first byte of the C struct. The toStruct() method must write this object's fields into the byte buffer exactly as the C struct is laid out in GPU memory.
        Specified by:
        toStruct in class Struct
        Parameters:
        buf - Byte buffer to write.

      • fromStruct

        public void fromStruct(ByteBuffer buf)
        Read this Java object from the given byte buffer in the form of a C struct. The byte buffer's byte order is little endian. The byte buffer is positioned at the first byte of the C struct. The fromStruct() method must read this object's fields from the byte buffer exactly as the C struct is laid out in GPU memory.
        Specified by:
        fromStruct in class Struct
        Parameters:
        buf - Byte buffer to read.
